questions.question_text:
Universal Containers is implementing a customer community.

What sharing mechanism should be used to allow customers to view their own cases even after those cases are assigned to a support agent?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
To allow customers to view their own cases even after those cases are assigned to a support agent, Universal Containers should use:

B. Sharing Set

Sharing Sets are used to extend sharing access to related records based on criteria specified in the sharing set definition. In this case, a sharing set can be created to grant access to cases owned by the customer to the customer themselves, regardless of who the case is assigned to.

questions.question_text:
The Universal Containers Experience Cloud admin needs to move a site from one production org to another production org that it is not directly connected to.

What is the recommended choice for moving the site from one org to the other?

discussion.content:
B. Lightning Bolt Export and Installation

Explanation:

Lightning Bolt Export and Installation is specifically designed for migrating Experience Cloud sites between orgs. It packages the site configuration, branding, themes, and other elements into a format that can be easily imported into a separate org. This approach is recommended by Salesforce for transferring sites across unconnected production environments.

Other options:

 • A (Metadata API) and D (Change Set) don’t capture all Experience Cloud site components, making them incomplete solutions for site migration.
 • C (Publication via Experience Builder) is used for publishing within the same org and isn’t applicable for cross-org migration.

This makes Lightning Bolt Export and Installation the most reliable and accurate choice for this scenario.

Selected Answer: CDE
CDE are correct. Don't believe Audience Sets are a thing.

C. Page Variations: Page variations allow for different versions of a page to be displayed to different audiences based on specified criteria, such as audience targeting.

D. Branding Sets: Branding sets allow for customization of the branding elements (such as logo, colors, fonts) for different audiences or purposes within the portal.

E. Audience Targeting: Audience targeting allows for content to be displayed selectively to specific audiences based on defined criteria, providing a personalized experience for users from different companies.

So, the correct options are C. Page Variations, D. Branding Sets, and E. Audience Targeting.

DreamHouse Realty (DR) plans to invite individuals from several new companies to its Broker Portal and would like to differentiate the user experience for each company.

Which three options should the DR system administrator use to personalize the look and feel of the portal for each new brokerage? (Choose three.)

Cloud Kicks (CK) has built a site using Salesforce Experience Builder. The CTO of CK wants to give customers the ability to log in to the site using their Google credentials. CK also wants to access customers’ basic Google profile data when they log in so the company can serve content that matches customers’ interests.

How should the Experience Cloud consultant implement this?

choices.A: Create a custom self-registration page and a custom login page by using Visualforce and Apex controllers.
choices.D: Create a custom login page using Lightning components and use the Google REST API to access customers’ basic profile data.
choices.C: Set up a login flow for communities that accepts the customers’ Google credentials and matches with the credentials stored on the user records in Salesforce.
choices.B: Create an Authentication Provider by choosing Google as the provider type and add relevant parameters to access the customers’ basic profile data.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Create an Authentication Provider by choosing Google as the provider type and add relevant parameters to access the customers’ basic profile data.

Using an Authentication Provider allows you to enable external identity providers like Google to authenticate users accessing your Experience Cloud site. By configuring Google as the provider type, customers can log in using their Google credentials, and you can configure the provider to access basic profile data as needed. This approach provides a seamless and secure login experience for customers while allowing you to access the necessary data to personalize their experience on the site.

questions.question_text:
Ursa Major Solar (UMS) is planning to build a portal for its partners. Among other things, UMS will be distributing leads to its partners in the portal.

Which standard component can UMS leverage if it elects to use Partner Central template?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Use the Lead Inbox component to share a common pool of leads with partners in your site.

The lead inbox uses a queue and the list view associated with a queue to pass leads to partners. Partners included in the visibility settings for the queue and list view can see and accept leads from the Lead Inbox. Accepting a lead makes the user the owner of the lead.

Selected Answer: A
Lead Inbox is correct here.
